data.title: Game crashes on startup
data.body: After I select a game from mod chooser (I tried both cnc and ra), the loading screen appears and then the game crashes. The exception log is here: http://pastebin.com/Wjwx5m9P. If I give write permissions to my user for file /usr/lib/openra/lua/scriptwrapper.lua, the game runs normally but it crashes in the settings screen. My OS is Manjaro linux. To get openra I used the PKGBUILD from aur and switched branch to bleed.

data.title: Remove remaining floating point calculations from simulation code.
data.body:
The Shattered Paradise stream had a couple of desyncs, which I suspect may be caused by fp disagreements that we don't see in the default mods because of our default values.  For consistency and safety we should work to remove the remaining fp calculations from the simulation code.

The ones I know (there may be more) are:
- [x] `WVec.LerpQuadratic` (can use Decimal or long)
- [x] `ReturnToBase.CalculateTurnRadius` (can use int constants)
- [x] `ProductionQueueInfo.BuildSpeed` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `CapturableInfo.CaptureThreshold` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `CapturesInfo.SabotageHPRemoval` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `EmitInfantryOnSellInfo.ValuePercent` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `EmitInfantryOnSellInfo.MinHpPercent` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `StrategicVictoryConditionsInfo.RatioRequired` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `SelfHealingInfo.HealIfBelow` (can use an int percentage)
- [x] `MinelayerInfo.MinefieldDepth` (can use WDist)

data.title: Game shouldn't crash if Valued: is not set on a Buildable unit.
data.body: Currently it causes a crash when you hover on the actor's cameo. If vauled is not set it should be free and shouldn't cost at all.

data.title: [TS] Units can't get out from factories if there are obstacles

milestone.title: Tiberian Sun Public Alpha
milestone.description: An incomplete list of blockers for a public alpha release.

data.body:
For example, infantry can't get out if I build it right behind a ConYard:

![cantbuild-cropped](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3705231/13371918/7e0dc852-dd3a-11e5-9b50-7559f9598cdc.gif)

Someone could say this is not a bug but it clearly affects annoyingly the gameplay and thus should be considered as one. I've not tested how the original TS handled kind of situation but at least the original RA2 could do it well.

Same as https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/137

Depends on #10838.

data.title: Extract map rules to external files (and map format changes).
data.body:
This upgrades our map format to version 9, with the following changes:
- Removed `Smudges` block.  Initial map smudges can now be defined using the `InitialSmudges` property on `SmudgeLayer`.
- Map UIDs are now calculated by hashing all yaml, lua, and bin file in the map package.
- Custom rules/sequences/weapons/etc are now defined in their own files referenced from map.yaml.  Maps can also files in the mod dir (e.g. `cnc|rules/campaign-tooltips.yaml, cnc|rules/campaign-palettes.yaml`), which a future PR will use to reduce duplication in the TD campaign.

This also changes the mod upgrade command to _not_ upgrade custom maps, which was a common frustration.

Fixes #4251.

Depends on #10838

data.title: Rework map loading and saving.
data.body:
- Fixes bogosity with `MapPreview` disposing
- Cleans the last nastyness from the `IReadWritePackage` interface.
- Prevents saving maps to non-writable directories (Fixes #9430).
- Final prerequisites for `.oramod` support.

data.title: Add tests for PriorityQueue
data.body:
- Added some tests to verify the queue does the right things.
- Fixed `Peek` to throw when the queue is empty.
- Adjusted the exception message to be consistent with the mesage from the BCL `Queue` & `Stack` when peeking/popping empty collections.
- Changed `if (level == 0 && index == 0)` to `if (level <= 0 && index <= 0)` to hopefully fix a false positive from static analysis via Coverity (this should provide a hint to the analysis that `level` and `index` cannot be negative in normal code paths)

data.title: Fix thread issue in AttackOrFleeFuzzy
data.body:
Threading is hard - let's go shopping.

Small fixup for #10731. Discovered by Coverity.

data.title: Shift locks arrow key scrolling
data.body:
When shift is held down and any arrow key is pressed this arrowkey will be locked as being pressed.

Example situation:
I want to put a light tank to scout a certain area, I'll be holding shift down to allow for waypoints. The issue is, I also tend to scroll using arrow keys at the same time. If I press the left arrow while shift is held down, the left arrow will be locked and the map will scroll endlessly left until left is re-clicked.

This issue appeared in the previous playtest before the current release, before that no locking was done.

data.title: Directional smoke trail support
data.body:
Would allow modders to implement smoke, dust and wave trails that actually match the actor's or projectile's facing.

Would also spare me from shipping custom variants of Smoke, Missile and Bullet in my MechCommander mod.
